metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：水文气象观测网数据集（混合林站自动气象站-2016）
metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological element observation data from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2016 at the downstream mixed forest station of heihe hydrometeorological observation network.The station is located at sidao bridge, dalaihubu town, ejin banner, Inner Mongolia.The longitude and latitude of the observation point are 101.1335e, 41.9903n and 874m above sea level.The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are located at 28m, facing due north.The barometer is installed in the anti-skid box on the ground;Tilting bucket rain gauge installed at 28m;The wind speed and direction sensor is located at 28m, facing due north.The four-component radiometer is installed at 24m, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 24m, facing due south and the probe facing vertically downward.Two photosynthetically active radiators were installed at a position of 24m, facing due south, with one probe vertically upward and one probe vertically downward.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm of the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm underground (observation at depths of 160cm,200cm and 240cm were increased on April 22), 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water probe was buried 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm underground (observation at depths of 160cm,200cm and 240cm were increased on April 22), 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil heat flow plates (3 pieces) are buried in the ground 6cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.
Observation items are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_28m, RH_28m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_28m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_28m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:C), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (in watts/m2), soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_60cm, Ts_100cm, Ts_160cm, Ts_200cm, Ts_240cm) (in:C), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_60cm, Ms_100cm, Ms_160cm, Ms_200cm, Ms_240cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage), upward and downward photosynthetically active radiation (PAR_up, PAR_down) (unit: micromole/sq.s).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;Due to the sensor problem, the wind direction was partly missing between April and April 21, 2016;The soil heat flux G1 is between 2.21-3.15, G2 is between 1.24-3.15, 4.4-4.22 and 12.1-12.21.(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2016-9-1010:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Li et al. (2013), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2016年1月1日至2016年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网下游混合林站气象要素观测数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗达来呼布镇四道桥，下垫面是柽柳与胡杨。观测点的经纬度是101.1335E,41.9903N，海拔874m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在28m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在28m处；风速与风向传感器架设在28m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在24m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；两个光合有效辐射仪安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm、100cm处（4月22日增加160cm,200cm和240cm深度观测），在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm、100cm处（4月22日增加160cm,200cm和240cm深度观测），在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_28m、RH_28m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_28m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_28m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm、Ts_160cm、Ts_200cm、Ts_240cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm、Ms_160cm、Ms_200cm、Ms_240cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_up、PAR_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；风向由于传感器的问题，在2016.4.4-4.21之间数据部分缺失；土壤热通量G1在2.21-3.15，G2在1.24-3.15、4.4-4.22和12.1-12.21之间由于传感器问题，数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2016-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.

findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波 Bowen 比率-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的涡度系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 在异质表面上生态水文过程的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了密集观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域被先前的研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Please provide an example of challenges faced in collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert areas.
Example.QuestionCn: 请提供在绿洲-沙漠地区收集多尺度生态水文数据时面临的挑战的例子。
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge in collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data is the poor availability of observations that can capture the diverse and intricate processes across varying spatial scales, especially due to the complex interactions between oasis and desert landscapes.
Example.AnswerCn: 收集多尺度生态水文数据的一个挑战是观察数据的稀缺，这些数据无法捕捉到不同空间尺度上复杂的过程，尤其是由于绿洲和沙漠景观之间复杂的相互作用。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of a dataset used to observe eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert areas?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 用于观察绿洲-沙漠地区生态水文过程的数据集的特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: multiscale, flux observation matrix, eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, eco-hydrological sensor network, soil moisture, leaf area index, hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing, LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, L-band microwave radiometer, synchronical ground measurements, vegetation dynamics, photosynthesis processes
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 多尺度、通量观测矩阵、涡度相关塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站、生态水文传感器网络、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、高分辨率机载遥感、激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪、L波段微波辐射计、同步地面测量、植被动态、光合作用过程。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What features are essential in a hydrometeorological observation network for capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在捕捉绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换时，水文气象观测网络中必不可少的特征有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: long-term data on energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, hydrometeorological data, radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil moisture profiles, auxiliary data involving vegetation and soil parameters, turbulent flux data acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, half-hourly and 10-minute average period observations
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 长期数据包括能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量、水文气象数据、辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水、土壤湿度剖面，涉及植被和土壤参数的辅助数据，通过涡度相关系统和闪烁仪获取的湍流通量数据，半小时和10分钟平均周期观测。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the properties of datasets that allow for the estimation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration in heterogeneous land surfaces?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 允许在异质土地表面估计蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发的数据集的属性是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, air temperature, wind speed, humidity, four-component radiations, turbulent fluxes, soil heat fluxes, high-resolution thermal cameras, observed ratios of evaporation and transpiration using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, eddy covariance measurements, partitioning of evapotranspiration into separate components using models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度、空气温度、风速、湿度、四组分辐射、湍流通量、土壤热通量、高分辨率热成像相机、使用稳定氧和氢同位素观测的蒸发和蒸腾比率、涡度相关测量、使用如双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型等模型将蒸散分为独立组分。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is a 'hydrometeorological observation network' in the context of eco-hydrological research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究的背景下，什么是“水文气象观测网络”？
Definition.AnswerEn: A hydrometeorological observation network in the context of eco-hydrological research refers to a system designed to collect meteorological and hydrological data over a specific area. It typically includes various sensors and instruments such as automatic meteorological stations, eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and eco-hydrological sensors. These are used to capture data on air temperature, humidity, wind speed, radiation, soil moisture, and other parameters to study water and energy exchanges in ecosystems.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在生态水文研究的背景下，水文气象观测网络指的是一个旨在收集特定区域内气象和水文数据的系统。它通常包括各种传感器和仪器，如自动气象站、涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和生态水文传感器。这些设备用于捕捉空气温度、湿度、风速、辐射、土壤湿度等参数的数据，以研究生态系统中的水分和能量交换。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods of the Daman superstation compare to those employed in the oasis-desert system for capturing eco-hydrological processes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: Daman超级站的数据收集方法与绿洲-沙漠系统中用于捕捉生态水文过程的方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The Daman superstation uses a boundary layer tower equipped with eddy covariance systems and a variety of sensors to measure meteorological and turbulent flux parameters, while the oasis-desert system employs a network of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations arranged in hierarchically nested scales. The oasis-desert system also integrates remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and imaging spectrometry to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 达曼超级站使用配备涡度协方差系统和各种传感器的边界层塔来测量气象和湍流通量参数，而绿洲-沙漠系统则采用一系列涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站，按层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。绿洲-沙漠系统还整合了遥感技术，如激光雷达和成像光谱仪，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the similarities and differences in data quality control processes between the observational datasets for the oasis–desert system and the hydrometeorological observations from the mixed forest station?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 观察性数据集的质量控制过程在绿洲-沙漠系统和混合森林站的水文气象观测之间有哪些相似之处和差异？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Both datasets emphasize rigorous quality control, including sensor calibration and data processing. The oasis–desert system data undergoes quality control throughout the data lifecycle, from sensor calibration to dataset generation, while the mixed forest station data handling includes steps like removing duplicate records and marking dubious data points, with a focus on maintaining consistent date and time formats.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 这两个数据集都强调严格的质量控制，包括传感器校准和数据处理。绿洲-沙漠系统数据在数据生命周期的各个阶段都进行质量控制，从传感器校准到数据集生成，而混合森林站的数据处理包括删除重复记录和标记可疑数据点，重点是保持一致的日期和时间格式。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges of estimating evapotranspiration in a strongly advective agricultural area compare to the challenges faced in observing eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在强烈的平流农业区，估算蒸散发的挑战与在绿洲-沙漠系统中观察生态水文过程所面临的挑战相比，有哪些不同之处？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Both scenarios deal with challenges of heterogeneity and complex environmental interactions. In the strongly advective agricultural area, the challenges include uncertainties in surface-air temperature differences and component temperature classifications. In the oasis-desert systems, the primary challenge is the poor availability of multiscale observations to upscale eco-hydrological processes. Both require reliable ground-based and remote sensing data to improve model accuracy and process understanding.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 这两种情境都涉及异质性和复杂环境相互作用的挑战。在强对流的农业区域，挑战包括地表与空气温度差异的不确定性和成分温度分类。在绿洲-沙漠系统中，主要挑战是多尺度观测的可用性差，难以对生态水文过程进行上尺度处理。这两种情况都需要可靠的地面和遥感数据，以提高模型的准确性和过程理解。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量面临的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to the incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0, the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference, and errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的，这主要是由于能量平衡闭合的不完整性，涉及到可用能量 Rn−G0、表面与空气温差的不确定性，以及从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is the availability of multiscale observations limited in the context of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在对异质表面进行生态水文过程的上升尺度研究时，多尺度观测的可用性为何受到限制？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The availability of multiscale observations is limited due to the inherent complexity of capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes and the need for hierarchically nested scales of instrumentation to effectively investigate oasis-desert interactions and other heterogeneous land surface characteristics.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测的可用性受到限制，因为捕捉多尺度生态水文过程的固有复杂性，以及有效研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用和其他异质土地表面特征所需的分层嵌套仪器尺度。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the high uncertainty of H estimation in irrigated farmland when using the TSEB model?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 使用TSEB模型时，灌溉农田中H估计的不确定性高的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The high uncertainty of H estimation in irrigated farmland when using the TSEB model is caused by image classification errors that vary with vegetation abundance, the uncertainty of the TSEB model itself, and errors in the eddy covariance system, which result in canopy temperature overestimation under developing vegetation abundance.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在使用TSEB模型对 irrigated farmland 进行H估计时，高不确定性是由于图像分类错误、植被丰度的变化、TSEB模型本身的不确定性以及涡度协方差系统的误差造成的，这导致在发育中的植被丰度下，冠层温度被高估。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the establishment of a sparse network of meteorological and flux observation stations affect data collection in oasis-desert interactions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 稀疏的气象和通量观测站网络的建立如何影响绿洲-沙漠相互作用的数据收集？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The establishment of a sparse network of meteorological and flux observation stations enables the capture of multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, facilitating the investigation of oasis-desert interactions. This approach supports the collection of comprehensive data sets, leading to a better understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in these complex ecosystems.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 建立稀疏的气象和通量观测站网络，使得能够捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程，从而促进对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的研究。这种方法支持全面数据集的收集，有助于更好地理解这些复杂生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What is the impact of integrating ground-based measurements with remote sensing data on understanding oasis-desert systems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将地面测量与遥感数据相结合对理解绿洲-沙漠系统的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating ground-based measurements with remote sensing data improves the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert systems. This combination allows for comprehensive coverage of multiscale observations, enhancing the ability to address challenges in eco-hydrological process upscaling and supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development in arid regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将地面测量与遥感数据相结合，可以提高对绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的理解。这种结合能够提供多尺度观测的全面覆盖，增强应对生态水文过程上升挑战的能力，并支持干旱地区的生态稳定和社会经济发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the main objectives of establishing a hydrometeorological observation network in heterogeneous land surfaces, particularly in semi-arid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在异质土地表面，特别是在半干旱地区建立水文气象观测网络的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The main objectives include understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, which is crucial for achieving carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, supporting ecological security, and sustainable development of the oasis. The network aims to provide quantitative insights into oasis–desert interactions and address challenges such as ecological degradation in inland river basins.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标包括理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，这对于实现碳达峰和碳中和、支持生态安全以及绿洲的可持续发展至关重要。该网络旨在提供关于绿洲-沙漠相互作用的定量见解，并解决内陆河流域生态退化等挑战。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to collect multiscale and multidisciplinary data in the context of eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous surfaces?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在异质表面的生态水文过程背景下，收集多尺度和多学科数据的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Collecting multiscale and multidisciplinary data is crucial for addressing the grand challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces. It helps overcome the limitations posed by the poor availability of multiscale observations and allows for a comprehensive understanding of interactions between oasis and desert systems, leading to better management and sustainable development of these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 收集多尺度和多学科的数据对于解决在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的重大挑战至关重要。这有助于克服多尺度观测稀缺所带来的限制，并使我们能够全面理解绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用，从而促进这些地区的更好管理和可持续发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intended outcomes of implementing high-resolution remote sensing techniques, such as thermal infrared cameras, in the monitoring of evapotranspiration in agricultural areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 实施高分辨率遥感技术，如热红外相机，在农业地区监测蒸散发的预期结果是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The intended outcomes include accurately estimating surface fluxes like evaporation and transpiration in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas. High-resolution remote sensing techniques, such as thermal infrared cameras, help in separating soil and vegetation component temperatures, which are crucial for estimating energy balance and improving the accuracy of models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 预期结果包括准确估计强烈对流灌溉农业区域的表面通量，如蒸发和蒸腾。高分辨率遥感技术，如热红外相机，有助于分离土壤和植被的温度，这对于估计能量平衡和提高像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的准确性至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What challenges arise in the collection and processing of multiscale observational data in oasis-desert systems, and how are these challenges addressed?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，收集和处理多尺度观测数据时会出现哪些挑战，以及如何应对这些挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting multiscale observational data include limited availability of multiscale observations, image classification errors, and the complexity of accurately measuring component temperatures in heterogeneous surfaces. These are addressed by deploying a hierarchically nested network of observation instruments, ensuring rigorous quality control through sensor calibration, and using advanced image classification methods to accurately separate soil and canopy pixels. Additionally, data processing involves careful calibration and validation against ground-based measurements to mitigate errors.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 收集多尺度观测数据的挑战包括多尺度观测的有限可用性、图像分类错误以及在异质表面上准确测量组件温度的复杂性。为了解决这些问题，部署了分层嵌套的观测仪器网络，通过传感器校准确保严格的质量控制，并使用先进的图像分类方法准确区分土壤和树冠像素。此外，数据处理涉及与地面测量进行仔细的校准和验证，以减轻误差。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What instrumentation and hierarchical observation techniques enable the capture of multiscale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些仪器和分层观察技术能够捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中的多尺度生态水文过程？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Instruments for the oasis-desert system are arranged in hierarchically nested scales, including a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. This setup captures multiscale eco-hydrological processes through intensive observation periods and continuous hydrometeorological observations.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行排列，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站的通量观测矩阵。该设置通过密集观测期和持续的水文气象观测，捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do technological advancements in thermal imaging enable better validation of evapotranspiration models in agricultural areas?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 热成像技术的进步如何能够更好地验证农业地区的蒸散模型？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of a high-resolution thermal infrared camera allows for the observation of soil and canopy component temperatures. These temperatures are used as inputs to models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, enabling better validation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration estimates by providing robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculations.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热红外相机可以观察土壤和冠层组件的温度。这些温度作为输入用于像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型，从而通过提供可靠的土壤和植被组件温度计算，增强蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发估算的验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methods enable the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集方法能够帮助理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Data collection methods include the use of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers to acquire turbulent flux data, as well as automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data collection. These stations observe variables like radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles, which are crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取湍流通量数据，以及自动气象站进行水文气象数据收集。这些站点观察辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面等变量，这些变量对于理解能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be significant challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas using current data collection methods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么使用当前的数据收集方法在强对流灌溉农业区准确估算地表通量可能会面临重大挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to the incomplete energy balance closure with respect to available energy and the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Errors can arise from determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the composite radiometric temperature, which affects the accuracy of the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model used for estimation.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域中，估算表面通量是具有挑战性的，因为可用能量与能量平衡的闭合不完全，以及表面与空气温度差的不确定性。由于从复合辐射温度中确定表层土壤和植被组分温度可能导致误差，这影响了用于估算的双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it expected that multiscale observations are necessary to understand eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么预计多尺度观测对于理解异质表面的生态水文过程是必要的？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations are necessary to understand eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces because these processes occur at different scales and require comprehensive data from various levels to be accurately captured and analyzed. The poor availability of such observations has hindered progress in this field, highlighting the need for a hierarchically nested observation system to address these complexities.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测对于理解异质表面的生态水文过程是必要的，因为这些过程在不同尺度上发生，需要来自各个层次的综合数据才能准确捕捉和分析。此类观测的稀缺性阻碍了该领域的进展，突显了建立分层嵌套观测系统以应对这些复杂性的必要性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the balance between oasis and desert systems be critical for achieving sustainable development in arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现干旱地区的可持续发展至关重要？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems is critical for sustainable development in arid regions because these systems play a crucial role in ecological stability and agricultural productivity. Understanding the exchange of energy, water vapor, and carbon in these ecosystems is essential for ecological security and socioeconomic development, especially in areas like western China where oases are vital for supporting the majority of the population.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对可持续发展至关重要，因为这些系统在生态稳定性和农业生产力方面发挥着关键作用。了解这些生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳的交换对于生态安全和社会经济发展至关重要，尤其是在像中国西部这样的地区，绿洲对支持大多数人口至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of the data collection methods used for capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估用于捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中多尺度生态水文过程的数据收集方法的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data collection methods such as hierarchically nested scales and instrumentation like eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations are effective in capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. These techniques provide comprehensive data that contribute to understanding the interactions in oasis-desert systems, although challenges remain in achieving multiscale observations.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法如分层嵌套尺度和仪器设备如涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站在捕捉多尺度生态水文过程方面非常有效。这些技术提供了全面的数据，有助于理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的相互作用，尽管在实现多尺度观测方面仍然存在挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your assessment of the challenges faced in accurately estimating surface fluxes in arid agricultural areas using the two-source energy balance model?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对在干旱农业地区使用双源能量平衡模型准确估计表面通量所面临的挑战的评估是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes include the complex nature of the model, which requires parameters and observations difficult to obtain from satellite and ground-based data. Additionally, uncertainties in surface-air temperature differences and strong advective environments complicate the accuracy of the model. These factors can lead to overestimations of component temperatures, affecting the model's performance.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 准确估计表面通量的挑战包括模型的复杂性，这需要从卫星和地面数据中获取难以获得的参数和观测值。此外，表面与空气温度差异的不确定性以及强的平流环境也使模型的准确性受到影响。这些因素可能导致对组成温度的高估，从而影响模型的性能。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, how significant is the role of long-term observational datasets in understanding the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在理解绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展方面，长期观测数据集的作用有多重要？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets are crucial in understanding the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases. They provide essential data on energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, which are vital for recognizing oasis-desert interactions. Such datasets support the goals of carbon neutrality and sustainable development by offering insights into the fundamental characteristics of these ecosystems.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集对于理解绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展至关重要。它们提供了关于能量、水汽和碳通量的基本数据，这些数据对于认识绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要。这些数据集通过提供对这些生态系统基本特征的洞察，支持碳中和和可持续发展的目标。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't quite understand how data quality control is ensured in the collection of meteorological data over a year.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不太明白在一年内收集气象数据时如何确保数据质量控制。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Quality control for meteorological data involves several steps: ensuring a complete daily data set with 144 data points (every 10 minutes), marking missing data with a specific value (-6999), removing duplicate records, deleting out-of-range data, and marking questionable data in red. Consistent formatting of date and time is also maintained.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 气象数据的质量控制涉及几个步骤：确保每天的数据集完整，包含144个数据点（每10分钟一个），用特定值（-6999）标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超出范围的数据，并将可疑数据标记为红色。同时，日期和时间的格式也保持一致。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how multiple datasets are integrated to study eco-hydrological processes in a region with heterogeneous surfaces.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解如何整合多个数据集来研究具有异质表面的区域的生态水文过程。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Integration of datasets for studying eco-hydrological processes involves the use of a multiscale observation system, combining data from eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, airborne remote sensing, and ground measurements. This system captures data across different scales and disciplines to address heterogeneity.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 生态水文过程研究的数据集集成涉及使用多尺度观测系统，结合涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站、航空遥感和地面测量的数据。该系统跨越不同尺度和学科捕获数据，以应对异质性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in estimating evapotranspiration (ET) and its components in oasis-desert environments using remote sensing and ground-based measurements.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析在使用遥感和地面测量估算绿洲-沙漠环境中的蒸散发（ET）及其组成部分时面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in estimating evapotranspiration (ET) and its components in oasis-desert environments include the heterogeneity of the surface, which affects the accuracy of one-source models, and the complexity of two-source models. Errors in component temperature estimation can arise from image classification errors, atmospheric conditions, and uncertainties in radiation measurements. The strong advective conditions in irrigated agricultural areas further complicate these estimations, making it difficult to achieve energy balance closure.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠环境中，估算蒸散发（ET）及其组成部分面临的挑战包括表面的异质性，这影响了一源模型的准确性，以及双源模型的复杂性。组件温度估算中的误差可能源于图像分类错误、大气条件和辐射测量的不确定性。灌溉农业区域强烈的平流条件进一步使这些估算变得复杂，导致难以实现能量平衡闭合。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential datasets that could be integrated with existing multiscale datasets to enhance understanding of eco-hydrological processes in arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探索可以与现有多尺度数据集整合的潜在数据集，以增强对干旱地区生态水文过程的理解。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets that could be integrated include long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes from additional oasis-desert systems, satellite-derived vegetation indices, and high-resolution climate models. Incorporating datasets from other arid regions or extending existing datasets with more diverse vegetation and soil types could improve the understanding of eco-hydrological processes. Additionally, data from global carbon cycle studies and cryosphere interactions in the upper reaches could enhance insights into regional and global ecological dynamics.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的整合数据集包括来自其他绿洲-沙漠系统的长期能量、水汽和碳通量观测数据、卫星衍生的植被指数以及高分辨率气候模型。整合来自其他干旱地区的数据或通过更多样化的植被和土壤类型扩展现有数据集，可以提高对生态水文过程的理解。此外，来自全球碳循环研究和上游冰冻圈相互作用的数据可以增强对区域和全球生态动态的洞察。
